sn56.59:1.1: “Mendicants, suppose a person was to place seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds on the Himalayas, the king of mountains.
sn56.59:1.3: Which is more: the seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds, or the Himalayas, the king of mountains?”
sn56.59:1.4: “Sir, the Himalayas, the king of mountains, is certainly more. The seven pebbles the size of mustard seeds are tiny.
sn56.59:1.5: Compared to the Himalayas, they can’t be reckoned or compared, they’re not even a fraction.”
sn56.59:1.6: “In the same way, for a noble disciple …
sn56.59:1.7: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
